frame.description: The wooden frame or structure of the loom upon which the warp threads are attached.
frame.name: Frame

heddles.description: The heddles are a series of loops or eyes in the warp threads through which the weft thread is passed.
heddles.name: Heddles

shuttle.description: A small, rectangular device used for passing the weft thread through the fabric.
shuttle.name: Shuttle

warp_beam.description: A long, narrow beam that holds the lengthwise warp threads in place on the loom.
warp_beam.name: Warp Beam

weft_bobbin.description: A small, cylindrical bobbin that holds the weft thread as it is woven through the fabric.
weft_bobbin.name: Weft Bobbin

loom.description: A machine used for weaving fabric or thread.
loom.name: Loom

Spinning wheel.description: A device used for spinning yarn or thread from fibers.

Warping mill.description: A machine used for preparing the warp threads of a loom.

Weft.description: The weft is the horizontal thread that is woven through the lengthwise warp threads of a fabric.
